text: hi everyone they're trying to placate
you with the facade of change but keep
fighting anyway here the Internet's
busiest music nerd and I hope you are
doing well it's time for a review of the
new Chloe and Halle album ungodly hour
this is the sophomore full-length LP
from singing songwriting producing duo
Chloe and Halle this is the first time
I'm really delving into the duo's music
but the more I hear in the more I read
the more I am impressed and surprised
surprised they're not bigger than they
currently are yes I know they've worked
with Beyonce and Joey badass and had a
song on the wrinkle and times soundtrack
they have millions of social media
followers and spent years acting before
thrusting themselves into the music
world professionally but despite their
best efforts with their debut record and
trying to turn the single do it into a
viral moment with a dance challenge on
Tik Tok they're really yet to land a
mega hit but I also want to point out
here it's impressive that despite all of
the industry support and mainstream
backing these two have received so far
that their creative process remains
incredibly hands-on if you take a peek
at the songwriting credits on this thing
you're just gonna see Chloe
Halle Chloe Cali Chloe Ally Chloe Ally
roughly the same with the production -
but it's Chloe Chloe Chloe Chloe Chloe
Chloe and Halle
now of course collaborators do come in
on this new full-length LP but all of
them seem very carefully applied and
chosen for a new record you're not
pulling on guys like Soundwave and Jake
one and Scott Storch unless you have
some serious taste and you know your
[ __ ] I deal with music fans day in and
day out who are Chloe and Halley's age
that don't know what the [ __ ] is Scott
Storch is this is a scare stench there
are some trendier names in the tracklist
on this thing as well like disclosure
Mike will Boy Wonder but ultimately this
just ends up being a part of the overall
reflection of the wide palette of pop
and R&B that Chloe and Halle are trying
to display on these 13 tracks all in all
this record sees Chloe and Halle pulling
off a very impressive balancing act
keeping the vibe of this record
contemporary while still very much being
in touch with the classic and
substantive elements that inform the
hits and
records of so many R&B greats the
opening intro track and the song forgive
feels like a rush of so many great
things at once it is crispy trap it is
elegant string kissed art pop it is a
grand soulful smoky Fugees number with a
touch of Janelle Monae in there too and
while not every moment in this tracklist
is amazing the versatility is something
to behold the following track baby girl
is an attempt at a Latin fusion on the
beat the groove is just okay the pacing
is a bit slow but the tune is certainly
there the breathy vocal leads that Chloe
and Halle play with throughout the song
or hooky as well
we then switch gears on the song do it
which is essentially a nod to this new
wave of minimal wavy trap music Scott
Storch on the production here and it
speaks to his incredible talent that he
can essentially pull together what is AP
airborne beyond this one but then add
some beautiful dynamics to it as it
progresses with a punchy set of rhythms
on the hook and that's before we've even
gotten into how good the song is sure
the verse vocals might be kind of
subdued but they get sweeter and sweeter
and the singing better and better as we
near the chorus especially on some of
the leads right before the hook cuz some
nights be better with you if that one is
too light for your ears then try the
track tipsy written and produced
entirely by Chloe and Halle it's one of
the most colourful and eccentric tracks
on the entire record playful vocal
harmonies some pounding drums what
sounds like some 8-bit ish bass backed
with a groove that feels like a nod to
some old-school dancehall
the lyrics are full of swagger and
charisma and threats about putting guys
in the ground essentially being tipsy on
someone's love or drunk on it to the
point where you're gonna do something
crazy and if you value your little life
than don't don't [ __ ] this up
the title track with production from
disclosure is a classy dance cut topped
with more dynamic vocal performances
with a sensual twist some jazzy
embellishments as well the flirty lyrics
and gently driving groove do a lot to
carry this one meanwhile the track busy
boy runs like an R&B throwback with some
added theatrics in the intro the
narrative is a classic tale of putting a
two-timer someone who's not faithful on
blast but now this story is playing out
in a world of texting and social media
pages
Chloe and Halle depicting the sky is
playing and texting a bunch of girls at
the same time lying about where he is
and because they know this keeping him
at a distance emotionally the biggest
selling points of this track though are
the snappy be packed with quirky
percussive Tambor's some of the drum
sounds on this track sound like
something weird Pharrell would pick out
the refrains of busy busy boy all over
the track also make this a damn Jam as
well so this fantastic run of songs then
gets derailed a little bit with the song
catch up featuring sway Lee who vocally
is just not in the same league as Chloe
and Halle I guess I get the need to have
at least one vocal feature on this
entire LP but there are any number of
rappers and singers who would have
outperformed sway Lee on this track and
it does not help that my quills
production here made for one of the
weakest beats on the entire LP - there
is a real aesthetic clash on this song
between
the very dramatic vibrato vocals that
Chloe and Halle bring to the table and
then there's the super loud crispy trap
high hats and snares when hand drums pop
up occasionally on the track they don't
really make sense in context with
everything else either it's a mess
thankfully the record does regain
composure pretty quickly with the
overwhelmed interlude and then lonely
immediately after which is a pleasant
nocturnal dreamy ballad with a sweet
sentiment coming out of the lyrics not
one of the bolder sounds on this entire
LP but the lead vocal melodies are still
pretty sweet and sticky however the
major highlights on this record keep
coming with don't make it harder on me
which is a true blues soul number with
the weepy rhythm guitars and glossy
vibraphone and dusty funk drums and
strings a totally killer choruses well
Chloe and Halle effectively throwing it
back to the 60s and 70s on this one and
sounding amazing doing it then with
wonder what she thinks of me the duo
continues to prove their talents by
working in this sudden piece of vocal
pop with a touch of musical theater
there is a broken-hearted side chick
story to this track with lots of campy
vocals and strings the lyrics on the
track great the overall tone of the song
fantastic I'm just not so sure about the
beat on this one the punchy kicks and
the
hits a dong that pop in every once in a
while they're they're very rigid and
don't really play to the fluidity of the
instrumentation on top of them the
backing B really lacks the elegance of
everything else in the mix in that way
it kind of reminds me of Lana Del Rey's
early stuff
however Chloe and Halle is singing on
this track is just way too good to
completely write this one off then the
track rest of your life ends the record
off on a somewhat playful and
light-hearted note with these overly
dramatic refrains about living tonight
and it could be paradise laced with
these effortlessly charismatic rap song
verses and choruses the song itself is
kind of one-dimensional but it does
leave me wanting more at the end I guess
overall not a bad effort from Chloe and
Halle I do look forward to hearing them
build off the best ideas they offered
here into the future while also proving
their versatility even further feeling a
light eight on this one transition did
